Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツ
Entry.EnglishText: Franz

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋のおかみ
Entry.EnglishText: Hostess

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: おばあさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車屋
Entry.EnglishText: Carriage Coach

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>
Entry.EnglishText: <unk19:D0FF1FC822E00C80>

Entry.JapaneseText: 村人の声
Entry.EnglishText: Villager

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: ここがアニカマルか。 こんなへんぴなところに 医者なんているのか？
Entry.EnglishText: So this is Anikamal? Is there really going to be a doctor in a place as remote as this?

Entry.JapaneseText: いったん宿屋に行って、 <Annie>を休ませよう。 医者探しはその後だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Let's get to an inn and let <Annie> rest for now. Then we can go looking for a doctor.

Entry.JapaneseText: 出て行ってくれ!! その娘はデスガロ熱なんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Leave here now! That girl has Deathgaro Fever, doesn't she?!

Entry.JapaneseText: この村が滅んじまう!! 早く出て行け!!
Entry.EnglishText: It'll kill everyone in the village! Get the hell out!

Entry.JapaneseText: 待ってくれよ！ 仲間の命がかかってるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Wait a minute! Our friend's life is at stake!

Entry.JapaneseText: それはこちらも同じだ。
Entry.EnglishText: So are ours.

Entry.JapaneseText: わかってるけどよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I get that, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: デスガロ熱は もうたくさんだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: We've all had enough of that infernal disease!

Entry.JapaneseText: でも……！
Entry.EnglishText: But...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もういいです…… <Tytree>さん……
Entry.EnglishText: Don't...worry... <Tytree>...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>……！ おまえ……
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>! You'll...

Entry.JapaneseText: わたしは、こんな…… ガジュマなんかに…… 助けてもらいたく、ない……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want help... from the likes of Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: よく言った、ヒューマの娘!! さっさと出ていけ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Well said, Huma girl! Now, leave this place at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: チクショウ、何て奴らだ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Damn those bastards!

Entry.JapaneseText: 怒ってる場合じゃないわ。 この娘はもう、限界よ。
Entry.EnglishText: Now isn't the time to get angry. The poor girl is barely holding on.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……小生のテントへ行こう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Bring her to my tent.

Entry.JapaneseText: 待て！ 聞いて欲しい!! 幻のバイラス・リブガロを倒し、 その角を取って来た。
Entry.EnglishText: Wait! Listen to me! We have defeated the Mirage Birus, Livgaro, and brought back its horn.

Entry.JapaneseText: この角があれば、デスガロ熱を 治す薬を作る事ができる。 そのためには、真っ暗な部屋が必要なんだ。 どうか、協力して欲しい!!
Entry.EnglishText: With this horn, we will be able to make a medicine which can cure Deathgaro Fever. For that purpose, we need a room that is pitch black. Please, cooperate with us!

Entry.JapaneseText: そんなもので本当に 治るものか！ 帰れ！
Entry.EnglishText: There's no way you can cure that with a stupid horn! Get out!

Entry.JapaneseText: おれたちには関係ない!!
Entry.EnglishText: It's your problem, not ours!

Entry.JapaneseText: デスガロ熱が流行ったのに、 この村は滅びずに残ってるのはなんでだよ!! 誰かが助けてくれたんじゃねぇのか!?
Entry.EnglishText: Back when Deathgaro Fever was devastating the entire region, how is it that this village was still left standing? It had to have been because somebody saved you, right?!

Entry.JapaneseText: それなのに、他人が困ってる時は 何もしてくれないっていうのかよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Despite that, you're not going to do anything for others in need?

Entry.JapaneseText: 力ずくで頼みたくはないが、 <Annie>に万が一の事あれば…… 俺は……
Entry.EnglishText: I really don't want to rely on brute force for this, but if anything happens to <Annie>, I...

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチを使っとくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: You can use my inn.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いいのですか？
Entry.EnglishText: ...Are you sure?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……！ 何考えてるんだ！ ばあさん！ やめろ！
Entry.EnglishText: ...! What are you doing, old lady?! Stop!

Entry.JapaneseText: 違う……違うんだよ。 ……この人の言うとおりさ。 数十年前、この村は助けられた……
Entry.EnglishText: No... It's you who should stop. These folks are right. Several decades ago, this town was saved...

Entry.JapaneseText: 病が流行った時、私は村の入口で、 この人の持っている角と 同じものを拾った…… それでこの村は救われたんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Back when the disease was sweeping through here, I picked up a horn near the entrance of town just like the one that man is holding... That is how the village was saved.

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかしたらあれは…… 砂漠から来た人たちが見つけ、 私らのために置いてってくれた ものだったんじゃないのかね……
Entry.EnglishText: I did wonder... Was it left there for our sake, by the same people we had helped?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……部屋をお借りできますか？ できるだけ日の当たらない部屋を。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Can we borrow a room from you? Preferably one with no sunlight.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……どこでも自由に 使えばいいさ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yes. Use whatever room you see fit.

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>!! もう大丈夫なの？
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>! How are you feeling?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ええ……もう自分で歩けます。
Entry.EnglishText: Better... I can walk on my own now.

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったな、<Annie>！
Entry.EnglishText: That's great, <Annie>!

Entry.JapaneseText: 皆さん……ありがとう……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone... Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったな、よかったぜ!! なあ、<Eugene>!!
Entry.EnglishText: This is great, just great! Right, <Eugene>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ああ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Sure.

Entry.JapaneseText: なにクールに決めてんだよ。 あんたが一番心配してた じゃねーかよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't start playing it cool now. You were the most worried out of all of us!

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったな……
Entry.EnglishText: What a relief...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうした、<Tytree>!?
Entry.EnglishText: What's wrong, <Tytree>?!

Entry.JapaneseText: へっ……へへっ…… 世界が回ってるぜ……
Entry.EnglishText: Heh... Heheh... Everything is spinning...

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、<Tytree>も デスガロ熱に……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Uh oh, has <Tytree> caught Deathgaro Fever?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いや……これは……！
Entry.EnglishText: No, this is...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……軽い日射病だ……
Entry.EnglishText: A mild case of heatstroke.

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:C4>……あの……
Entry.EnglishText: <scale:C4>Um...

Entry.JapaneseText: <scale:E0>あのぉ……
Entry.EnglishText: Umm...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: くぅぅぅー！ 治ったぁ治ったぁい!!
Entry.EnglishText: Sweeeet!! I'm cured, I'm cured!

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったネ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Good for you!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ!! <Annie>、おまえは大丈夫か？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh yeah! <Annie>, are you sure you're all right?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes.

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツさん、本当に ありがとうございました。
Entry.EnglishText: Franz, I can't thank you enough.

Entry.JapaneseText: いやいや、 小生もリブガロをこの目で 見る事ができて大満足だよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: The pleasure is all mine. I can't believe I was able to see a Livgaro with my own two eyes!

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツさんは、 これからどうするの？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you going to do now, Franz?

Entry.JapaneseText: 準備が整ったら新しい冒険に出る。 小生には、まだまだたくさん やるべき事があるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I will embark on a new adventure once my preparations are in order. There is still much I have yet to do.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Blue>世界七大まぼろし<White>を 追うんだネ？
Entry.EnglishText: So you'll be chasing the <Blue>Seven Great Illusions<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、大いなるロマンだ。 そろそろ小生は行く事にするよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Right, it'll be my greatest undertaking. I should get going now.

Entry.JapaneseText: フランツさんとお別れするのは なんか寂しい感じもするなぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: Too bad we have to part ways with you, Franz.

Entry.JapaneseText: なーに、お互い旅をしてれば どこかでまた必ず会えるさ。 それじゃあ、また!!
Entry.EnglishText: Nonsense! As long as we both keep traveling, our paths will cross again. Until next time!

Entry.JapaneseText: すみません…… わたしのせいで、寄り道を する事になってしまって……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry... We got sidetracked because of me...

Entry.JapaneseText: この場合は、仕方がねえさ！ あんまり気にすんなよ、<Annie>。
Entry.EnglishText: It's not like it was your fault! Don't sweat it, <Annie>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……とはいえ、姉貴と クレアさんが心配だ。 急ごうぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: ...Having said that, I'm still worried about Selena and Claire. Let's hurry!

Entry.JapaneseText: 行こう。 <Blue>王の盾<White>を追うんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We have to get going so we can catch up to the <Blue>Royal Shield<White>.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここから南東に向かって、 クロダダク砂漠を越えた先に バビログラード方面へ渡る シーラグ橋がある。
Entry.EnglishText: We need to head south-east to get to the Shirag Bridge, which connects the Kurodadaku Desert to the Babilograd area.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一気に突っ切って、 遅れを取り戻すんだ。 準備はいいか？
Entry.EnglishText: As long as we don't take any more detours we can make up for lost time. Is everyone ready?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green><scale:140><speed:0><font:80000002><Annie>が復帰しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie> is now able to participate in battles.

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、大変!! 助けなくちゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, this is horrible! We have to help him!

Entry.JapaneseText: イイ気味だ！ 年寄りを粗末に扱った罰だ！ バイラスにやられてしまえ！
Entry.EnglishText: He's just fine! That's what they get for disrespecting the elderly! I hope those Biruses do him in!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんて事を……！ 同じ村の仲間がやられてるのに……！
Entry.EnglishText: How could you say that? Our neighbors are in danger!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私だけでも助けに行くわ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm going to save them, even if I have to do it alone!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた……五つ星だぜ!!
Entry.EnglishText: You know what... you're Five Stars!!

Entry.JapaneseText: オレたちが行く。 やるぞ、みんな!!
Entry.EnglishText: We'll help him. Let's go, guys!

Entry.JapaneseText: ありがとう…… おかげで助かった……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you... If it weren't for you, I'd be a goner.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、どうして…… 俺は……あんたたちを 追い出したっていうのに……
Entry.EnglishText: But why...? I... I kicked you out of town...

Entry.JapaneseText: そんな事、考えるヒマも なかったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: There wasn't time to think about things like that.

Entry.JapaneseText: 同じ村の仲間を助けるのに、 理由なんて必要ない……
Entry.EnglishText: You're all from the same village, you shouldn't need a reason to save your fellow townsfolk.
Our fellow townsfolk...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマとかガジュマとかいう前に、 あんたたちはみんな、 <Yellow>ご近所<White>だったんじゃないのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Huma or Gajuma, what does it matter? Aren't you all <Red>neighbors<White>?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……だ、だが、 わしらを追い出したのは こいつらなんだぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: But they're the ones who drove us out of town!

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、それは……！ ……すまない……許してくれ…… いや、許してください！
Entry.EnglishText: T-that was... That was wrong of me... Forgive me... Please, forgive me!

Entry.JapaneseText: 謝ってすむ問題じゃない！ わしは許さん！
Entry.EnglishText: Apologizing ain't going to make up for that! Apology not accepted!

Entry.JapaneseText: もう、やめなさいよ！ 謝ってるんだから、 許してあげればいいでしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, just stop it already! He apologized, so you might as well forgive him.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうですよ……
Entry.EnglishText: She's right.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなただって、ここのところ、 ガジュマの悪口ばかり 言ってたじゃないですか。
Entry.EnglishText: After all, haven't you been doing nothing but bad-mouthing Gajuma lately?

Entry.JapaneseText: お互いに、反省するところが あるんじゃありませんか？
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you think that you both could use a little self-reflection?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……後は、みんなで なんとかできそうだネ。
Entry.EnglishText: It looks like they should be able to work things out on their own now.

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の街にも 行ってみましょう。
Entry.EnglishText: We should see how the other towns are faring.

Entry.JapaneseText: 申し訳ありません。 馬車は運休となっております。
Entry.EnglishText: We're truly sorry, but Carriages are not available for use at the moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>お金が足りないようですね。 馬車のご利用料金は <nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>You seem to be short of money. The fee for using the carriage is <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>馬車をご利用になりますか？ 料金は定額で<nmb:12C>ガルドになります。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000000>Would you like to use a carriage? The fare is a flat rate of <nmb:12C> Gald.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車を利用しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Travel by Carriage? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: ミナール
Entry.EnglishText: Minal

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: サニイタウン
Entry.EnglishText: Sunnytown

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd

Entry.JapaneseText: 馬車に乗らない
Entry.EnglishText: Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダ
Entry.EnglishText: Razilda

Entry.JapaneseText: ピピスタ
Entry.EnglishText: Pipista

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: ノルゼン
Entry.EnglishText: Nolzen

Entry.JapaneseText: モクラド
Entry.EnglishText: Mocrado

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>馬車で<unk18:48DC0C28B8048880>に移動します。 料金<nmb:12C>ガルド はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002>A Carriage ride to <unk18:48DC0C28B8048880> will cost you <nmb:12C> Gald. Do you want to take the Carriage? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: 他をあたってくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ask someone else!

Entry.JapaneseText: 出ていけ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Leave!!

Entry.JapaneseText: 確かに病気を持ち込んだのは よそから来た連中だった……
Entry.EnglishText: It's true that outsiders brought sickness in our village...

Entry.JapaneseText: とはいえ、 我らもよそ者に対する態度を 改めねばならんのかもな……
Entry.EnglishText: At any rate, I think we should change our attitude towards strangers...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんた、ヒューマと一緒にいて 平気のようだが……なぜだ？
Entry.EnglishText: You're with Huma, yet you look fine... How so?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシなど、この前、よそから来た 偉そうなヒューマを殴り飛ばして やったわ……スカッとしたぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Earlier I sent some pompous looking Huma flying out the village. That was great!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマよ、殴られたくなければ ワシに近づくな……いいな！
Entry.EnglishText: Listen here, Huma, keep your distance unless you want to get slugged!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなぞ 連れて歩くんじゃないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Don't walk around with those Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: せっかくヒューマがいなくなって 風通しがよくなっておったのに……
Entry.EnglishText: It feels less stuffy now that those Huma are gone!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの客人は 大歓迎じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma visitors are very much welcome!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そっちのヒューマが おらなんだらの……
Entry.EnglishText: If only that Huma wasn't here...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……さっさと出て行くんじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: They should hurry up and disappear!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシも行き過ぎはあったが、 長年、積み重なった色々な 問題があるんじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: I might've gone too far, but a lot of problems can accumulate over many years...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと以前のように戻るのは 簡単ではなさそうじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't think it's going to be easy getting along with Huma like before...

Entry.JapaneseText: 昔から地鳴りがする時は、 尻尾を隠せと言われておる。
Entry.EnglishText: It's said that one should hide their tail whenever a rumbling occurs.

Entry.JapaneseText: 大地の底から現れる巨大な 化け物に尻尾を食われるから だと言われておるが……
Entry.EnglishText: If one fails to do so, a giant goblin will come from under ones' feet and eat it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマの争いは 他の街でも起きておるそうじゃな。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently, Gajuma and Huma are also fighting in other cities.

Entry.JapaneseText: それぞれの街、それぞれの国を 作ったほうが、案外うまく行く かもしれんのう……
Entry.EnglishText: It might be better if each city just cooperated with each other.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何十年もかかってしみついた よそ者嫌いの気持ちは 一朝一夕では直らんが……
Entry.EnglishText: This hatred that has been with me for decades won't just disappear overnight, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かと努力は しておるつもりじゃぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have to try and get along with others.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと!! おまえら、邪魔だよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're in my way! Move!

Entry.JapaneseText: まだいたのか!? この疫病神が！
Entry.EnglishText: You're still there, huh!? You harbingers of death!

Entry.JapaneseText: すまない……俺…… ずいぶんヒドイ事を あんたたちに……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry, I've said some horrible things to you...

Entry.JapaneseText: 昔の話だけどさ、もともとこの街には、 ヒューマなんていなかったらしいぜ。 昔のままなら良かったのになぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: It was a long time ago, but apparently this city used to not have any Huma. I wish I was born in the past...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはどうにも 憎たらしい……けど…… おまえはそうでもないな。
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are always horrible, but...you don't give off that feeling.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん、ヒューマどもが！ ここは昔はガジュマの街だったんだ。 偉そうに歩くんじゃない！
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph! Who do you think you are!? This city was once owned by Gajuma! Don't walk around like you own the place!

Entry.JapaneseText: そこのお姉さんがさ、 おかしな事を言ってるんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You know, that lady over there was saying some strange things.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの角がどうとか…… ヒューマに角なんてあるわけ ないのにな……
Entry.EnglishText: That she saw a Huma with horns and stuff... As if there's a Huma that has...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……角……ヒューマ…… ハーフの事か……!?
Entry.EnglishText: Horns... Huma... Did she mean Halfs!?

Entry.JapaneseText: そっちのお姉さんが言うには 角の生えたヒューマがいたん だってさ！
Entry.EnglishText: That lady over there said that she saw a Huma with horns!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらヒューマに 角なんてあるわけないよな!?
Entry.EnglishText: There no one like that among you, right!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ただでさえ変な姿なのに、 角まで生えてたら、気持ち悪くて まともに見られないぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Huma already look weird, adding horns to them would just make it even weirder!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと歩いてたら、 ヒューマくさいのが うつっちまうぜ!!
Entry.EnglishText: You'll get some Huma stench on you if you stay with them!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマくさいっ！ なんだよ、せっかくヒューマが いなくなったと思ったのに……!!
Entry.EnglishText: You stink! Sheesh! Just when I thought those Huma were already gone...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 東大陸に、ガジュマだけの 村があるそうじゃねえか。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that there was a village in Eastalia exclusively for Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: この村を、そんな理想郷にするのさ。昔はそうだったらしいしな！
Entry.EnglishText: We'll make this village a paradise just like that! Just like how it used to be!

Entry.JapaneseText: 話しかけるな！ ガジュマの理想郷から出て行け！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't talk to me! Leave and don't desecrate this Gajuma paradise any more!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……い、今は誰とも話したくない。 ほっといてくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't want to talk to anyone at the moment... Please leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何なんだ、この音は…… 遠くで聞こえるだけなのに どうにも不安だ……
Entry.EnglishText: What's this sound...? I can hear it from far away, it's making me anxious.

Entry.JapaneseText: よくわからないんだ…… ガジュマとヒューマは違う 種族だろ……？
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know, but Gajuma and Huma are both different races, right...?

Entry.JapaneseText: それをまったく同じように 考える事自体、無理がある んじゃないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: It's impossible to think of them as the same, isn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマと対立したいわけじゃない。 ヒューマの良い部分も知ってる……
Entry.EnglishText: I didn't mean to make Huma look bad, I know that even they have their good points.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、違うものは違うだろ？ そこから目をそむけるのは おかしくないか？
Entry.EnglishText: But different races are different, right? Don't you think it's weird to deny that?

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の中央には大きな池があるのさ。 あれが俺たちの生命線なんだぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's a huge pond in the middle of this village. It's an important part of our daily lives.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんで砂漠の真中に 水が溜まってるかって？ それはな……
Entry.EnglishText: So how did water end up in the middle of the desert? Well that's...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……俺にはわかんねえな……
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea!

Entry.JapaneseText: 病人がいるんだ。 どこかに医者はいないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Our companion is sick. Do you know where we can find a doctor?

Entry.JapaneseText: 知らないわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no idea.

Entry.JapaneseText: 知らないって…… この村の住人だろ？
Entry.EnglishText: You have no idea...? But you live here?

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさいわね。 邪魔よ、どっか行って。
Entry.EnglishText: Shut up. You're annoying me, go away.

Entry.JapaneseText: アッチ行ってって 言ってるでしょ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Didn't I tell you to go somewhere else!?

Entry.JapaneseText: 近寄らないで!! 出てって……！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't come near me! Go somewhere else!

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか昔、そんな事が あっただなんて……
Entry.EnglishText: To think that something like that had happened before...

Entry.JapaneseText: お、恐ろしいものを見たわ…… つ、角の生えたヒューマが カレーズのほうに……
Entry.EnglishText: I-I saw something scary... Th-there was a Huma with horns... At Karez...

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の人に言っても、誰も 信じてくれないのよ……！ 本当に見たのに……！
Entry.EnglishText: I-I keep telling everyone, but they don't believe me!! I really did saw one!

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、ハーフ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Could they be...a Half?

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん……ヒューマなんかに 言っても信じないだろうけどね 見たんだよ、角の生えたヒューマを！
Entry.EnglishText: Hmm... It's not like a Huma like you would believe me, but I really did see one of you with horns!

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかして……ハーフ!? その人はどっちへ行ったの!?
Entry.EnglishText: Are they...a Half!? Where'd they go!?

Entry.JapaneseText: カレーズのほうへ行ったよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Karez! Th-They went to Karez!

Entry.JapaneseText: カレーズ……
Entry.EnglishText: Karez...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私は見たんだよ！ 角の生えたヒューマを！
Entry.EnglishText: I saw them there! There was a Huma with horns there!

Entry.JapaneseText: もしかして……ハーフ!? その人はどっちへ!?
Entry.EnglishText: Are they...a Half!? Where...!?

Entry.JapaneseText: カレーズのほうさ！ ウソだと思うんなら、 行って確かめてみな！
Entry.EnglishText: I remember! They're in Karez! You might not believe me, but it's true! Go see for yourself!

Entry.JapaneseText: 前はよそ者が来るとイヤな 感じがしたんだけど、今は ヒューマのほうがイヤだね。
Entry.EnglishText: I used to just hate outsiders before, but now I think I hate Huma even more.

Entry.JapaneseText: 近くにいるだけで落ち着かないって いうか、イライラしちゃって。 あなたは平気そうで、うらやましいわ。
Entry.EnglishText: Just being near them aggravates me. I'm jealous that you can stay with them for so long.

Entry.JapaneseText: ぼうや、ヒューマなのに 別にイライラしないわね…… どうしてかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: Young man... You're a Huma, yet, I don't feel irritated when near you... I wonder...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……近くに来ないで！ ヒューマは……ヒューマなんて 見るのすらイヤなのよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't come near me! I... I don't want to see any Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒューマなんかと 一緒にいるの!?
Entry.EnglishText: What are you doing, walking around with Huma!?

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒューマが この村にいるの!? 出て行きなさいよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Why are you here, Huma? Leave!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマなんて この村には必要ないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: This village has no place for your kind!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんたたちの言う事は よくわかるけど……今さら 仲良くなんて……できるのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I understood what you said, but... I wonder if...we can still get along?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマ………… 前はそんな事、あまり考えずに 生きてた気がするわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma and Huma... I feel like I used to not think about such things, before.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマへのわだかまりが なくなったわけじゃないわ…… でも、このままじゃいけないって思うの。
Entry.EnglishText: It's not like my feelings towards Huma have changed, but... I can't just let this continue.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音はなんなの……？ 砂嵐でも来るのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: What's this sound...? Is there a sandstorm coming?

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな不気味な空…… 始めて見たわ…… 一体、どうなってるの？
Entry.EnglishText: This is the first time I've seen the sky like this... What on earth is happening?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマへのわだかまりが なくなったわけじゃないわ…… でも、このままじゃいけないって思うの。
Entry.EnglishText: It's not like my feelings towards Huma have changed, but... I can't just let this continue.

Entry.JapaneseText: ここアニカマルは 砂の中の緑の街。
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal is a lush town in the middle of the desert.

Entry.JapaneseText: 砂漠のエメラルド、 蜃気楼に浮かぶ砂の街、 乾いた旅人の癒しの水がめ……
Entry.EnglishText: The emerald of the desert, the city of sand in the mirage, a pool of water to quench the traveler's thirst.

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々な呼び方をする人がいるわね。
Entry.EnglishText: It's goes by many names.

Entry.JapaneseText: うわあっ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Waah!!

Entry.JapaneseText: しまった!! まだ、いたか……！
Entry.EnglishText: Damnit! There's still more?

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥の方だヨ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: やったか……
Entry.EnglishText: Was that the last of them?

Entry.JapaneseText: まだ、あっちにもいるヨ!!
Entry.EnglishText: No, there's more that way!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『アニカマル式 水がめ』 アニカマルの赤土を使って焼き上げた 薄くて固くて軽い水がめ。 この水がめにワインを入れて、ひと晩 寝かせておくと、十年ものの味がする。 時々悪用してる商人もいるので注意。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Anikamal Ceremonial Water Jug - Baked out of red clay from Anikamal, this jug is hard despite its thinness and lightness. If you put wine in this and let it sleep overnight, it will taste like it's 10 years old. Take heed that some merchants abuse this.
